availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Felix Crady (Larue County, Kentucky, resident and soldier in the 37th KY)

body.p: Larue County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Daniel Crady and Margaret Crady. Resident in Larue County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident in Larue County in 1860. Served in Company D 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from October 24, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, Hamiltons, p. 448A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, p. 323.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, Hodgenville, p. 47A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 417.
"Felix Crady," Louisville Courier-Journal (KY), January 17, 1918, Newspapers.com, https://www.newspapers.com/image/119524312/?terms=%22Felix%20Crady%22&match=1.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 373.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #1114646, Certificate #853917.
